alert.note: Alert for Northern Foot Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 05 at 2:41AM MDT until April 06 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .Snow will develop early Wednesday morning and continue through most of the day. The heaviest snow is expected in the morning, with up to 6 inches possible in the higher elevations above 5500 feet and north facing slopes. Much less snow can be expected at lower elevations with up to 3 inches possible. The snow combined with wind gusts potentially over 60 mph will impact travel, especially in open areas. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches, with locally higher amounts possible at higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...The Northern Foot Hills. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 6 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
